intro: Incarvillea sinensis, commonly known as Chinese bellflower, is a perennial herb native to China. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long blooming period, which extends from spring to early summer.
